metadata.Title: CVE-2022-0336 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Samba AD users with permission to write to an account can impersonate arbitrary services

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2022-0336` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libnss-winbind - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libpam-winbind - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libsmbclient - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libwbclient0 - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
python3-samba - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
registry-tools - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
samba - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
samba-common - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
samba-common-bin - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
samba-libs - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
samba-testsuite - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
smbclient - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
winbind - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1').
